roleset.name: carry along with, move literally or metaphorically

role.descr: attribute, state after bringing, secondary action

example.name: active, attributive
example.text: The surge brings to nearly 50 the number of country funds that are listed in New York or London.
example.arg: the number of country funds that are listed in New York or London.
example.note: To distinguish between a destination/benefactive and an attribute in a "to__" PP, consider the following:A destination/benefactive HAS nearly 50An attribute IS nearly 50(The number of country funds IS nearly 50).

example.name: with ablative
example.text: [They]-2 may risk *trace*-2 bringing some damaging influence from outside the markets.

example.name: active, attributive again
example.text: Bush administration officials are looking to [the Fed]-1 *trace*-1 to bring down rates.

example.name: passive, attributive
example.text: ...the Whiting field, the first of [five small fields]-2 scheduled *trace* to be brought *trace*-2 into production before the end of 1990.

roleset.note: Follow PReditor's suggestions for phrasal brings--the particle isoften the same as an attribute, but they can cooccur (eg "bring in aspresident").

predicate.note: Frames file for 'bring' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus

roleset.name: bring up: raise, broach the subject (but not child-rear)

example.name: issues
example.text: The meeting brought up important issues that everyone ignored.

roleset.note: I don't know that all of these will be needed, but here they are justin case.

roleset.name: process criminal charges against

example.name: I assume they mean Den Haag, not the Hollywood jazz club.
example.text: # 6 *PRO* Bringing Bush / Cheney up on criminal charges for war crimes . -LRB- send them to the Haig !!! -RRB-
example.arg: on criminal charges for war crimes

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls.

roleset.name: bring_up: rear a child (or other growing entity)
roleset.note: Added by Julia during unification to correspond to 'upbringin-n.01'

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: *PRO* Bringing up children is hard on a graduate student's wages.

example.name: args 0, 1, 3
example.text: John had brought those frogs up from tadpoles.

example.name: args 1,2
example.text: I-1 was brought up [*-1] Lutheran, but my wife was raised Catholic

roleset.name: bring down: make fall

example.name: the government
example.text: The vote could have brought down Pakistan's government.

roleset.note: I don't know that all of these will be needed, but here they are justin case.

example.name: bring along
example.text: She could bring along her humility and a little thespian skill.
example.arg: her humility and a little thespian skill

example.name: and there was light
example.text: ``You're telling someone [they]*-1 can spend the next three or four or five or six years of their life [*-1] bringing about the most difficult and costly modernization of an information system on the civil side ever,'' Mr. Goldberg said.
example.arg: the most difficult and costly modernization of an information system on the civil side ever

roleset.name: cause onset

example.name: Both args
example.text: I do n't want to guess their specific motives , but it seems to me that such an arrangement could be very advanategous for those nations in the event of a crisis brought * on by peak oil .

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls.
